review_title: Good environment in the clinic setting
job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) in Sedalia, MO
pros: Clinic setting provides better days/hours for people who need that kind of schedule. Many clinics/specialties to choose from.
cons:
Pay - expect a pay cut if coming from long term care
Possibility of floating to other areas of need

pros: Small, supportive, friendly people, ease of scheduling
cons: Politics, pay, staffing, lack of specialists

pros: Co-workers become family. Many unit managers have worked the floor. Great house supervisors.
cons: Make advancement somewhat difficult. During pandemic and government was giving funds to hospitals, they froze raises and didn't offer incentives until well into pandemic. They don't properly staff ancillary departments and increase nurse responsibilities. Safety takes a backseat to profit. Starts projects and abandons them to start new projects. Benefits aren't great for being a hospital.

pros: Environment, people, schedule, hours, always staying busy
cons: Pay, workload, schedule, lack of help from others

pros: Good work family to work with
cons: Sometimes feel totally drained, managers not clinical background

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) in Sedalia, MO
pros: Foundation is great! Employee certificate is great and cane be used on dr bills,
cons: On the clinic side it’s feels like it’s all about money, not patient care. Making you feel bad for “being over staffed”. Absolutely no over time on the clinic side

review_title: There’s many departments and people there that’s amazing in what they do
pros: Techs are pleasant and helpful. Willing to help out in the department. The Radiologist are very nice
cons: The department as management is awful! There’s no teamwork at all, supervisor and management need to go the whole department needs to be replaced.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Work is work that works
cons: Unconstitutional Mask and Vaccine Mandates garbage

job_title: Family Nurse Practitioner in Sedalia, MO
pros: Support staff work hard! Patient care is challenging but rewarding.
cons: No flexibility , no contract, no insensitive for productivity. One thing was said upon hire and then changed after starting as there is “no contract”

pros:
Good Benefits
Multiple shift options
Cafeteria/Ozarks in hospital
cons:
Management is stretched thin
Not much room for growth

job_title: Hospital Patient Transporter in Sedalia, MO
pros: Great coworkers. People help each other out and support each other.
cons: Communication between departments is not always spot on.

pros: Absolutely Nothing  that I can think of other than the cafeteria has a nice salad bar when They have the cafeteria fully staffed, which is rare!!
cons: Absolutely one of the worst Healthcare Facilities I’ve ever worked at in my career! Workload is unbelievable, Nurses constantly call for results, equipment constantly goes down. Some Departments are not even close to being CMS Compliant!! New Employees channel through there like a revolving door!  Such a shame for a decent size small town, would not want to be a patient there because they are constantly understaffed or filled with green employees with absolutely bear minimum training completed! Very sad that many of America’s Heartland Healthcare  Orgs. Have become revolving doors , with no integrity, and cutthroat business/management tactics! Breaks are frowned upon and lunch is frequently missed out on too. So glad I don’t work there anymore, it was a nightmare Because of the workload and the distance from my home!

review_title: This could be a great place to work if it weren't for Hospital Administration
pros:
Most of the employees are really caring people wanting/trying to do a good job under difficult circumstances.
Department managers care about employees and work environment.
cons: Hospital Administration is terrible; constantly bullying people.  The HR department is the worst.  Hospital Administration are less than honest in dealing with employees.  There is a big disconnect between nursing departments and other departments.  Nursing has an "Us against them" mentality.

pros: Great staff, feeling of family, willingness to help each other.  Opportunity to grow exists for some
cons: Staffing limitations, administration.  Benefits are not cheap

pros: Voted "Most Wired" Hospital  2 of last 3 years.
cons: Dysfunctional nursing managers and can't trust Human Resources department

pros: Ease of access to the facilities. Campuses are navigable.
cons: Lack of communication, little teamwork, no consequences for poor behaviors

job_title: Registered Nurse, Critical Care in Sedalia, MO
pros: Small town hospital and well like throughout the community.  Worked well with the employees and doctors
cons: Small hospital and transferred more severe patients

pros: Employees care about the patients and families.
cons: Sedalia is far from Kansas City.   There is not much to do on the weekends.

review_title: My experience at Bothwell has been warm and inviting.
pros: Coworkers are reliable and present.
cons: Can’t say I have any at this time.

pros: Lots of interaction with the public
cons: A very catty environment, supervisors are terrible and inconsistent The core values that are taught are not upheld by the managers of this department Training is also inconsistent
